resources.string: Feedback and error reports, about widget
Show the Android Battery Info dialog
Show the dock battery gauge even when not docked \n May be overridden by the previous setting
Show a message stating that the secondary battery is not connected when not docked
Where to display the battery status
Margin size is the same as the text size
Shows the battery label in the bottom margin. \n Can be overruled if the battery status is displayed in the same place

The Dual Battery Widget was initially created for the Asus Eee Pad Transformer, a device that has a second battery in the dock station. Unfortunately, the standard Android tools do not provide any way of displaying the status of a second battery, so this widget was created to fill this gap. 
 
 The author of this widget is Artiom Chilaru, and it was initially posted on the xda-developers forum. It is distributed for free on the Android Market. If you paid for it, or downloaded it from any other place, I would strongly recommend uninstalling your copy, and installing it from the market. This way you can make sure that your copy has no malware attached to it, and you will get free updates to the latest version as soon as it's released! 
 
 Note: If you use a custom rom, there is a high chance that this widget will not be able to identify the dock status, or even register that your device supports it at all.. This is a restriction of most custom kernels at this moment, not of this application. 
 This is because Asus extended their Android kernel build to send extra information about the dock and the dock battery along with battery status notifications. Unless this change has been merged in the custom kernel, it will not be sending these notifications 
 
 You can install the widget from the marketplace here: https://market.android.com/details?id=org.flexlabs.widgets.dualbattery 
 
 To find more about the author, you can check out my website http://www.flexlabs.org or my twitter account @artiom_chi 
 https://twitter.com/artiom_chi 
 
 You can also check out the topic on the xda-developers forum here: 
 http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=1123363 
 
 If you have any issues, use the feedback option inside the aplication settings window, or send me an e-mail to android@flexlabs.org
Please explain in a few words what did you do when the application crashed:

Oops, it seems like you're running a custom built kernel. Unfortunately, as far as I know, only a small number of them currently broadcast the dock battery status. 
 Until they migrate this part of the kernel from the standard Asus kernel, getting this information isn't quite possible :( 
 
 The widget will still display the main battery battery, and there's still some chance that it will see the dock battery too...
